properties.areaDesc: Lewis and Southern Nez Perce Counties
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 8:25PM PST until January 11 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW SHIFTING INTO IDAHO AND FAR NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...

.Snow is tapering off in the Spokane Area and on the Palouse but remains
moderate to heavy in areas of the Idaho Panhandle and far northeastern
reaches of Washington.  Light to moderate snow showers also continue
along the Cascade Crest.  Another disturbance will move into the
region overnight with light snow showers returning to most locations
across Eastern Washington and North Idaho.  Additional accumulations
of 1 to 3 inches will be possible with locally higher amounts with this
second wave into Saturday..

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3
inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph resulting in areas
of blowing and drifting snow.

* WHERE...Kamiah, Craigmont, Nezperce, Winchester, and Soldiers
Meadow Road.

* WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 4 PM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST SATURDAY
